originall hebrew chalde text therefore blind presumption boldnesse romanists may herein appeare shall amisse note speciall place wherein latin translation hath greatly erred 1 c 6 v 15 latine translator readeth viri intelligentes regem dixerunt c men vnderstanding king said c whereas originall word hargishu came together 2 c 7 v 18 saint shall take kingdome l truely translated thus shall take kingdome saint p 3 c 8 2 gate vlai l originall riuer vlay p v word vbal riuer 4 c 8 v 9 strength l toward pleasant delectable land v p g hatzebi beautie delight selfe 5 c 8 v 13 said l said p v c word eelai 6 c 11 6 make friendship l make equall peace p v mesharim rectitudines equalitie rightnes 7 c 11 v 8 shall carrie captiue god grauen image l god prince p v g nesichehem prince nesich prince 8 c 11 v 22 armes fighter shall subdued l armes ouerflowing shall ouerthrowne p v shataph ouerflow 9 c 11 45 shall plant tabernacle apadno l tabernacle pallace p v g 10 c 12 2 shame vt videant semper may alwaies see l shame perpetuall contempt p v g word diron contempt place giuen instance coniecture may made rest translation beeing erroneous compared grauitie authoritie originall place moment wherein translation often slippeth shall noted diuers reading vpon euery chapter 2 controv historie susanna song three child bell dragon part daniel canonicall scripture romanists would thus perswade history annexed daniel make vulgar latine translation 13 14 chap canonicall 1 councell trent hath defined held canonicall scripture 2 vsed recited romane leiturgie masse canonicall scripture 3 cited alleadged diuers father 4 diuerse father greeke church origen athanasius chrysostome cyril doe hold parcells canonicall thus bellar lib 1 de verb dei c 9 pintus prooem perer lib 16 daniel praefat contra 1 tridentine councell chapter rather true generall councell partiall conuenticle romanists wherein many bishop congregate assembled together haue beene many prouinciall synod 2 though beene lawfull synod yet lawfull authoritie make canon scripture belongeth onely vnto god church onely declare constitute sacred canon 3 neither produce generall councell wherein pontificiall canon scripture contra 1 caluin answereth monarchie romanes beganne caesar long macedonian kingdome dissolued 2 vnsufficient answer 1 monarchie till time iulius caesar gouernment sometime democraticall popular sometime aristocraticall gouerned consul therefore till became monarchie could fourth kingdome spoken 2 though fift kingdome fourth beganne together yet inconuenience followeth continue together fift kingdome commeth must ruine argument therefore rabbine inuincible opinion make romane monarchie fourth kingdome 3 therefore rabbines argument make answer fourth kingdome diuided two consisting two vntill l liuing may knowe high hath power ouer kingdome men man c giueth appointeth ouer abiect men 18 dreame king nebuchadnezzar haue seene thou belteshazzar tell interpretation thereof wisemen kingdome able make knowne interpretation thou art able spirit holy god thee 19 daniel whose name belteshazzar amazed stood astonished v held peace l b g word shamam signifieth properly astonished amazed wonder space houre thought troubled king spake said let neither dreame interpretation thereof trouble thee belteshazzar answered said dreame hate thee interpretation thereof thine enemy 20 tree thou sawest great mightie whose height reached vnto heauen sight thereof earth 21 whose leaues faire fruit thereof much meate vnder beastes field dwelt foules heauen sit 22 thou king art great mightie thy greatnesse growen reacheth vnto heauen thy dominion ende earth 23 whereas king sawe watchman holy one came downe heauen said hewe downe tree destroy yet leaue stumpe rootes thereof earth band yron brasse bind among grasse field let wet dewe heauen let portion beast field till seauen time passe ouer 24 interpretation king king decree high come vpon lord king 25 shall driue thee men thy dwelling shall beast field shall make thee • ate grasse like ox thou shalt • l shall wet thee dewe heauen till thou knowe high beareth rule ouer kingdome men giueth whomsoeuer 26 whereas said said l leaue stumpe tree rootes thy kingdome shall stable vnto thee remaine vnto thee l b g thou shalt haue knowne hast learned knowe l heauens beare rule 27 wherefore king let counsell acceptable vnto thee breake thy sinnes righteousnesse g b redeeme thy sinnes v l almes deed l pharach signifieth breake taken gen 27 40 word tzidecah signifieth righteousnesse thy peace may prolonged p v better may healing thine error g b god may forgiue thy sinnes l 28 thing came shall come g touch b vpon king nebuchadnezzar 29 ende twelue moneths walked palace kingdome babylon 30 king spake said great babel haue built house thee men thy dwelling shall beast field shall make thee eare grasse shall cause thee tast grasse c like ox seuen time shall passe ouer thee vntill thou knowest high beareth rule ouer kingdome men diuerse wayes answered 1 first vnnaturall thing men liue grasse herbeslib 6 cap 30 plinie writeth certaine people ethiopian liue rawe locustes onely herbes rootes others doe eate thing commeth hand obserueth see experience furious mad men doe put mouthes teare teeth whatsoeuer commeth hand 3 beside • temperament constitution bodie altered changed distemperature mind might made fit applyable vnto tekel signifieth hath weighed phrase taken merchant goldsmith vse exactly weigh gold light doe reiect refuse god exactly tried examined life workes balthazar found light 2 doe thus apply similitude though sinnes balthazar weighed one balance pressed downe light pietie vertue appeared verie small perer hugo thus expoundeth god hath weighed time thy life iamillud declinare pronuntiat pronounceth declining scoale inclineth sinketh downe rather balthazar found beeing weighed god iustice light scoale quasinullum pondus haberet though weight daniel expoundeth caluin 3 thus phrase vsed scripture iob saith c 6 2 3 misery laid together balance would heauier sand sea meaning misery valued equall iudgement would found heauier seemed pintus giueth sense though iob thinke affliction beeing weighed sinnes would found heauie iob farre accusing god iniustice misery sorrowes laid vpon greater sinnes 4 seeme strange phrase weighing balance beeing vsed signifie iust examination triall apocal 6 5 sate vpon blacke horse pintus expoundeth deuill haue paire balance hand farre sathan doe thing measure weight pintus therefore giueth sense said haue ballance non quod illa vtatur sed quod videatur vti indeede vseth iust balance seemeth vse sense place rather blacke horse signified dearth famine scarcitie thing balance scant exact weight corne food weighed vnto 5 interpretation two thing insinuated long honouring prophet might thinke obtaine pardon sinne citie beeing besieged king beene altogether besotted might haue put king minde present danger seemeth securitie good thought thinke sinne might forgiuen 3 thinke king kept promise ne coram hominibus mendacij arg • eretur leaft might men haue beene found lie lyran constant vse custome king persia keepe word intelligebat proprium esse regis reioyce giue thankes death 3 pererius deliuereth opinion subscribeth probable antiochus captaine host killed stone cast stone thunder vpon captaine euident antiochus vnderstood captaine v 13 14 albeit captaine seemed inuincible yet slaine temple nanea antiochus though would dwell came thither receiue money vnder title dowrie antiochus himselfe pretended mariage nanea diana like reported tiberius nero heliogabalus would make marriage goddess therefore came himselfe person receiue dowrie treasure temple 4 bellarmine pererius likewise doe approoue solution thus interpret word v 13 cecidit templo naneae captaine host fell temple nanea smitten slaine bellarmine giueth instance like place gen 14 10 king sodome gomorrah fell slimie pit discomfited killed king sodome met abraham afterward pererius reiecteth saying iewes nobis illud dictum iudaorum quod per inuidiam loquebantur non est tantae authoritatis c v saying iewes great authoritie set euident place scripture likewise bullinger thinketh iewes might ouerlash speach said christ thou art yet fiftie yeare old ioh 8 57 yet neuer saw fourtie although iewes speake vpon blind tradition contrarie scripture regarded yet see receiued opinion concurre scripture euent answerable thereunto reiected 46 yeares mentioned beeing counted cyrus third worke ceased doe agree prophesie 7 weekes 49 yeares cyrus first 2 iosephus scalliger likewise reiecteth testimonie iewes lib 6 de emendat tempor vpon reason 7 weekes appointed building citie streete temple one must vnderstood building ierusalem includeth also building temple otherwise mention moneths reckoneth 48 yeares finishing temple beganne two yeares going forth word beginning building 46 yeares going forth word 48 contra neither two yeares expired going forth word vnto beginning yeares emman sa 7 ex pellicano certaintie time aboad stayed till herod dead 5 whereas herod rage caused infant killed two yeare old vnder according time diligently enquired wisemen followeth second moone betweene two euenings scaliger well obserueth iosephus time euening sacrifice ninth houre going downe sunne space 3 houres 15 day beganne till sunneset therefore space betweene two euenings ende 14 day time fift day weeke beginning 15 day sixt weeke iosephus scaliger holdeth christ iewes eate passeouer instant vpon 14 day euen according law next day suffered first day vnleauened bread better maintenance assertion presseth argument 1 otherwise iewes haue aduantage v obiect christ suffered vpon festiuall day wherein kept passeouer type substance agreed together 2 grecian vphold opinion eucharist must ministred leauened bread christ gaue vnto disciple leauened bread also affirme christ eate passeouer one day sooner iewes eate 3 vrgeth place mark 14 12 first day vnleauened bread sacrificed passeouer disciple said vnto hence inferreth time passeouer generally eaten christ also eate 1 an question bellarmine romanists concurre io scalig bellarmine answered el wheresynops contr 13 qu 4 therefore onely examine scaligers argument 1 iewes vpon blind tradition deferred pasch auoid concurrence two sabbath haue bin yeare wherein christ suffered first solemne day pasch bin kept according law vpon 15 day ordinarie sabbath followed next yet christ kept law prescribed suffered day wherein pasch haue bin solemnized typical lamb true lambe notwithstanding agreed together christ sacrificed time first day passeouer haue bin kept law though iewes corrupt custome vsage kept 2 grecian may ground error vpon true position followeth christ preuented common eating passeouer therefore eate passeouer leauened bread bin law exod 12 8 although leauened bread yet put iewes house yet christ sending disciple might prouide vnleauened bread paschal supper grecian hereupon ground opinion eucharist onely ministred leauened bread romanists otherside doe stiffely maintaine superstition vnleauened bread onely must vsed holding christ time eate passeouer rest iewes 3 marke respecteth right speaketh king daughter daughter south come king north 4 thus haue meaning word shee shall reteine power arme shee namely berenice long continue grace fauour antiochus arme embrace two king together tooke possession countrey caused himselfe crowned king 3 hearing commotion egypt returned carried away many noble captiues verie great spoile beside 40 thousand talent gold many pretious vessel 2500 image god among cambyses carried egypt whereupon superstitious egyptian called euergetes benefactor hierome 3 ptolome returned seleucus prepared great nauie ouerwhelmed sea himselfe hardly escaped fewe companie hauing nothing left great preparation much case pitied reuolted craued aid antiochus hierax brother ptolome perceiuing made peace seleucus 10 yeares oecol melanct ex iustin 4 hierax seeing turneth force brother seleucus warre tended ruine destruction hierax slaine certaine robber theeues seleucus died fall horse 5 beeing thus reported forren writer iustin lib 27 polybius lib 5 iosephus writeth euergetes comming ierusalem offer sacrifice vnto god great victorie bestowed great gift vpon temple lib post aduers appion yet afterward demaunded ordinarie tribute 20 talent siluer oecolampadius quest 36 meaning word chittim v 30 1 two word vsed tziim chittim hebrewes vnderstand italian romanes hierome first word signifieth shippes commeth tzi properly betokeneth bird consequently shippe beeing vnder saile like bird flieth 2 iosephus theodoret followeth vatablus vnderstand shippes chittim shippes isle cyprus towne called citium zeno stoike borne word chittim generall taken one small island cyprus vnder command alexandria nowe antiochus besieged therefore shippes cyprus could repell antiochus 3 take chittim directly romanes hierome also chalde paraphrast tharg hierosol interpreteth place italian romanes numb 24 24 shippes shall come coast chittim subdue ashur shall subdue heber originally chittim italian romanes chittim one sonnes iavan father grecian likewise elisha founder aeliseans aeolian dodanim dodoneans tharshish cilicians tarsus countreys belonging vnto grecia 4 thinke chittim signifieth grecian macedonian romanes calvin make generall name
